column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Jane T. Sibley'''  of [[wikipedia:Haddam
column4: Connecticut]]. It informs the reader that the [[runes]] in ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' are not the same set. Typed on Tolkien's own
column5: preprinted paper (self-addressed to [[76 Sandfield Road]]. Signed and accompanied by a handwritten note suggesting further reading. Copyright by the [[Tolkien Trust]].

column1: * '''Publication:''' The letter was first printed in an article by Jane T. Sibley in ''Niekas'' 38
column3: 67). A revised version of the material was published in [[Vinyar Tengwar 6|''Vinyar Tengwar'' 6]] ([[July]] [[1989]]): a photocopy reproduction of the letter is featured on the back
column4: and commentaries and a transcription (by Sibley) are given on pages 7-8.
